data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Jeskai (U/R/W) artifact deck centered on counters and proliferate, led by Inspirit, Flagship Vessel. The primary strategy involves using charge counters and +1/+1 counters to power up artifacts and creatures, leveraging proliferate effects to accelerate these counters exponentially. The deck aims to win through incremental value, creating large artifact creatures (via Titan Forge, Cyberdrive Awakener), dealing direct damage (Alibou, Ancient Witness, Lux Artillery), or achieving an alternate win condition (Darksteel Reactor). The commander provides a resilient endgame by granting other artifacts hexproof and indestructible once it becomes a creature.
data.name: Counter Intelligence

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Jund (Black, Red, Green) Lands-Aristocrats deck helmed by Hearthhull, the Worldseed. The primary strategy revolves around sacrificing lands for value, recurring them from the graveyard, and leveraging landfall/sacrifice triggers to create a formidable board presence and drain opponents. Key engines like The Gitrog Monster, Titania, Protector of Argoth, and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King generate immense card advantage and tokens, while the commander provides card draw and a life-drain payoff. The deck aims to win through overwhelming combat with large creatures and tokens, supplemented by incremental life loss from sacrifice effects.
data.name: World Shaper

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a +1/+1 counters-focused deck led by Tidus, Yuna's Guardian. The primary strategy is to deploy creatures that generate or benefit from +1/+1 counters, use Tidus to redistribute counters at combat, and leverage the "Cheer" ability for card draw and proliferation to snowball value. Win conditions revolve around overwhelming combat damage with large, evasive creatures (aided by Sphere Grid's trample/reach) and using Walking Ballista as a direct damage outlet. The deck has strong synergistic value engines but lacks fast, game-ending infinite combos.
data.name: Counter Blitz

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a WUB (Esper) control/combo deck centered on Y'shtola, Night's Blessed. The primary strategy is to cast high mana value (MV 3+) noncreature spells to trigger Y'shtola's life-draining ability, controlling the board while draining opponents' life totals. The deck leverages this incremental damage to fuel Y'shtola's end-step card draw, creating a value engine. It aims to win through a combination of this life drain, large token armies (from cards like Champions from Beyond and Summon: Good King Mog XII), and a potential big Exsanguinate or Rite of Replication finish. The deck features numerous legendary creatures with spell-slinging synergies but lacks dedicated fast mana or efficient tutors.
data.name: Scions & Spellcraft

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Mardu (R/W/B) graveyard reanimator deck led by Terra, Herald of Hope. The primary strategy utilizes self-mill (via Terra's Trance, Stitcher's Supplier, Millikin) and discard (Laughing Mad, Big Score) to fill the graveyard with creatures, then reanimates them for value using spells like Reanimate, Stitch Together, and Terra's own combat damage trigger. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents through recursive value, leveraging "enters-from-graveyard" payoffs like Flayer of the Hatebound and Celes, Rune Knight, with a potential late-game finisher in Rise of the Dark Realms.
data.name: Revival Trance

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Naya (RGW) Equipment-focused deck led by Cloud, Ex-SOLDIER. The primary strategy is to deploy and attach Equipment to creatures, leveraging Cloud's attack trigger to draw cards and generate Treasure tokens. The deck aims to win through overwhelming combat damage, using Equipment to boost creature power and enable additional combats via Tifa, Martial Artist. It features a sub-theme of Soldier tribal and artifact synergy, with recursion and value engines to maintain momentum.
data.name: Limit Break

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a 5-color Tribal/Changeling deck led by Morophon, the Boundless. The primary strategy is to use Morophon's cost reduction and anthem effect for a chosen creature type (typically "Shapeshifter" or "Sliver") alongside cards like Maskwood Nexus and Arcane Adaptation to make all creatures share that type. This enables massive card draw via Kindred Discovery, overwhelming board presence with lords like Coat of Arms, and one-sided board wipes with Kindred Dominance. The deck aims to win through combat by creating a wide, synergistically buffed army of changelings and tribal support creatures. A potential near-infinite draw combo exists but requires multiple specific pieces.
data.name: Everyone's Invited

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This Temur Dragons deck leverages Eshki's scaling triggers to generate card advantage and burn damage while deploying high-power Dragons. While lacking infinite combos, it focuses on synergistic creature casting with moderate ramp and protection. Key strengths include tribal synergy and Eshki's snowball potential, but it struggles against heavy interaction and lacks fast mana.
data.name: Temur Roar

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is an Abzan (White/Black/Green) "Toughness Matters" deck led by Felothar the Steadfast. The primary strategy is to deploy numerous high-toughness creatures, especially those with Defender, and use Felothar (or backup cards like Assault Formation and Walking Bulwark) to enable them to attack for massive damage equal to their toughness. The deck generates value through Defender-triggered card draw (e.g., Wall of Omens), life gain (e.g., Wall of Reverence), and mana acceleration (e.g., Axebane Guardian). It aims to win through overwhelming combat damage, supported by synergistic value engines and some large finishers like Zetalpa, Primal Dawn.
data.name: Abzan Armor

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Jeskai (U/R/W) spellslinger deck built around Shiko and Narset, Unified. The primary strategy is to cast multiple instant and sorcery spells each turn to trigger the commander's "Flurry" ability, which either copies a targeted spell or draws a card. The deck leverages "Magecraft" and "Prowess" creatures (e.g., Veyran, Voice of Duality, Monastery Mentor) to generate overwhelming board presence and value. It aims to win through combat with a growing army of tokens and boosted creatures, supplemented by direct damage from cards like Guttersnipe and Caldera Pyremaw.
data.name: Jeskai Striker

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Mardu (R/W/B) token aristocrats deck helmed by Zurgo Stormrender. The primary strategy revolves around creating a wide board of creature tokens, attacking to trigger Zurgo's Mobilize ability, and then sacrificing those tokens for value. The deck leverages "leaves the battlefield" and "whenever a creature dies" triggers from cards like Bastion of Remembrance, Thalisse, Reverent Medium, and Morbid Opportunist to drain opponents and draw cards, aiming to win through incremental combat damage and life loss. It functions as a mid-range value deck with a strong go-wide and sacrifice subtheme.
data.name: Mardu Surge

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Sultai (B/G/U) graveyard midrange deck led by Kotis, Sibsig Champion. The primary strategy is self-mill to fill the graveyard with creatures, then leverage Kotis and other recursion engines (e.g., Meren of Clan Nel Toth, Phyrexian Reclamation) to repeatedly cast creatures from the yard. This fuels Kotis's growth and generates value from enter-the-battlefield and graveyard-leave triggers. Win conditions include combat with massive creatures like Lord of Extinction and Avenger of Zendikar, draining with Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord, or overwhelming value from recursive loops.
data.name: Sultai Arisen

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Zombie tribal deck led by Temmet, Naktamun's Will. The primary strategy is to establish a wide board of Zombie creatures, leverage Temmet's card-draw triggers to pump the team, and win through combat damage augmented by "Zombie ETB" drain effects (e.g., Corpse Knight, Wayward Servant). The deck includes strong recursive elements (Gravecrawler, Rot Hulk, Liliana, Death's Majesty) and value engines like The Scarab God for inevitability. It operates as a mid-range, value-oriented tribal deck without fast, game-ending infinite combos.
data.name: Eternal Might

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Temur (G/U/R) Energy and Artifact token deck led by Saheeli, Radiant Creator. The primary strategy is to cast Artificer and artifact spells to generate energy counters, using Saheeli's ability to create hasty 5/5 copies of key permanents. The deck wins through incremental value, overwhelming board states with artifact creature tokens (Thopters, Servos, Constructs), and combat damage amplified by cards like Adaptive Omnitool and Stridehangar Automaton. It features several synergistic loops to generate large amounts of energy and tokens, but lacks a fast, reliable infinite combo.
data.name: Living Energy

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a 5-color "Alternate Win Condition" deck helmed by Go-Shintai of Life's Origin. The primary strategy is to stall the game using pillow-fort elements (Ghostly Prison, Pariah), board wipes, and value creatures, while assembling one of over a dozen different "you win the game" conditions. These range from Maze's End and Biovisionary to Liliana's Contract and Helix Pinnacle. The commander provides recursion for key enchantments and creates token bodies, but the deck does not rely on it as a central engine. Wins are slow, telegraphed, and require surviving a full turn cycle.
data.name: 20 Ways to Win

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Rakdos "Group Slug" deck led by Valgavoth, Harrower of Souls. The primary strategy is to inflict consistent, incremental life loss on all opponents through a dense suite of "punisher" effects (e.g., Mogis, God of Slaughter, Spiteful Visions), death triggers (e.g., Blood Artist, Syr Konrad, the Grim), and damage-based board wipes. Valgavoth serves as both an engine and payoff, growing and drawing cards whenever an opponent loses life for the first time each turn. The deck aims to grind down the table's life totals over several turns, finishing with large life-swing effects like Gray Merchant of Asphodel or Massacre Wurm.
data.name: Endless Punishment

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Simic (Green/Blue) value deck centered on landfall, manifest, and turning face-down permanents face up for incremental advantage. The commander, Zimone, Mystery Unraveler, provides card advantage and board presence through her "manifest dread" ability, which synergizes with numerous cards that care about face-down creatures entering or being turned face up (e.g., Deathmist Raptor, Trail of Mystery). The primary win conditions are combat-based, leveraging large creatures (Worldspine Wurm, Hydra Omnivore), token armies (Scute Swarm, Ezuri's Predation), and overrun effects (Overwhelming Stampede). The deck has a strong land ramp package but lacks fast, game-ending infinite combos.
data.name: Jump Scare!

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a slow, controlling Esper enchantment deck led by Aminatou, Veil Piercer. The primary strategy is to leverage Aminatou's miracle cost reduction to cast powerful enchantments like Terminus and Entreat the Angels for cheap, while using a suite of other enchantments for board control, incremental value, and token generation. The deck aims to stall the game with removal and defensive pieces like Sphere of Safety, then win through combat with Angel tokens or by reanimating/value engines like Arvinox, the Mind Flail. It lacks fast mana and efficient tutors, focusing on a slow, grindy game plan.
data.name: Miracle Worker

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Golgari self-mill and delirium deck helmed by Winter, Cynical Opportunist. The primary strategy is to fill the graveyard quickly using mill and surveil effects (e.g., Stitcher's Supplier, Grim Flayer) to achieve delirium (four card types in graveyard). Once achieved, Winter's end-step ability reanimates key permanents like Titania, Nature's Force or Hornet Queen for free, creating a value engine and overwhelming board presence. The deck wins through combat with large, recursive threats and incremental value from planeswalkers like Professor Onyx.
data.name: Death Toll

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This Gruul deck, led by Bello, Bard of the Brambles, focuses on ramping into high mana value (MV 4+) non-Equipment artifacts and non-Aura enchantments, which Bello animates into 4/4 Elemental creatures with indestructible, haste, and card draw on combat damage. The strategy combines traditional ramp and big creature beats with the unique angle of attacking with animated permanents, supported by power-matters synergies (e.g., Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma, Greater Good) and doubling effects (Unnatural Growth, Gratuitous Violence). It aims to win through overwhelming combat damage, typically by turns 8-10.
data.name: Animated Army

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Bant (Green/White/Blue) "Group Hug / +1/+1 Counters" deck led by Ms. Bumbleflower. The primary strategy leverages the commander's triggered ability, using a high volume of spellcasting to draw cards, distribute +1/+1 counters, and create evasive threats. The deck supplements this with a "gift" subtheme (giving opponents cards/resources) and multiple alternate win conditions based on hand size (Triskaidekaphile, Twenty-Toed Toad), +1/+1 counters (Simic Ascendancy), and card draw pings (Psychosis Crawler). It aims to out-value opponents through symmetrical draw and incremental advantage, winning via combat or a specific condition. No infinite combos are present.
data.name: Peace Offering

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Jeskai (U/R/W) token-swarm deck led by Zinnia, Valley's Voice. The primary strategy revolves around casting numerous creatures with base power 1 (e.g., Agate Instigator, Rapid Augmenter) to boost Zinnia's power and leveraging her "offspring" ability to create token copies. The deck aims to flood the board with tokens from cards like Murmuration and Siege-Gang Commander, using them for value, card draw (Curiosity Crafter, Bident of Thassa), and combat wins supported by anthem effects and unblockable attacks (Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive). It is a synergistic "go-wide" deck without infinite combos, winning through incremental value and combat damage.
data.name: Family Matters

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Golgari Squirrel and token aristocrats deck led by Hazel of the Rootbloom. The primary strategy is to generate a large number of creature tokens (especially Squirrels) and Food/Blood/Treasure artifacts. These tokens fuel Hazel's mana ability, create overwhelming board states for combat wins (e.g., End-Raze Forerunners), and trigger "death drain" effects (e.g., Poison-Tip Archer, Bastion of Remembrance) for incremental life loss. The deck utilizes powerful token doublers like Chatterfang, Squirrel General and Second Harvest to accelerate its game plan.
data.name: Squirreled Away

data.author: Wizards of the Coast
data.description: This is a Jeskai (U/R/W) Energy and Token deck helmed by Satya, Aetherflux Genius. The primary strategy revolves around generating and spending energy counters to create a wide board of token copies, draw cards, and take extra turns. Satya enables explosive attacks by creating temporary copies of powerful creatures, which can be made permanent with sufficient energy. The deck contains several combos that can generate infinite energy, leading to infinite turns, combat phases, or damage, though they require assembling 3-4 specific pieces.
data.name: Creative Energy
